channel.title: weeknotes on Stuart McColl
channel.description: Recent content in weeknotes on Stuart McColl

item.title: Weeknotes (05/07/19)
item.description: The weeknotes for this week are incredibly late, but as I’d half-written them, I think it’s probably worthwhile to finish them. For best results, pretend you’re reading these a week ago. I feel like I’m already falling behind a little bit on my ‘start the week with a list of things to achieve’ plan. I’ve been particularly busy at work to the point that I’ve barely looked at my list since writing it over the weekend.

item.title: Weeknotes (12/07/19)
item.description: Weeknotes are harder than I anticipated. Not actually writing them, but finding the time to write them. I’m actually writing these before I’ve written the previous weeks’, which probably isn’t the approach you’re supposed to take. I’m going to try and write up a section each day next time, rather than try to do it all in one go at the end of the week. No weeknotes next week, as I’m on annual leave ðŸŽ‰.

item.title: Weeknotes (21/06/19)
item.description: I moved into a new role semi-recently which also involved moving into a new team, which was coming to the end of the alpha phase of a project. In theory, the role shouldnâ€™t be hugely different to the one I was already fulfilling (itâ€™s an upgrade in seniority) and the differences that are there were things that I knew up front. Software development during the alpha phase of an agile project is very different to software development during the beta phase.
